result.execSummary:
The defendant Marcus L Pantoja was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-Heroin(>10-50g) [Modifiers: Second/Subsequent Drug Offense], a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(d)3.
  • Possession of Firearm by Felon, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: EACH COUNT:  Court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including DNA surcharge.  To be paid through collection by DOC from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b).  Any remaining balance due by 3/15/2022.  Failure to pay will result in an entry of a civil judgment.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with count two and to case 14CF828; but consecutive to any other sentence. Credit for 374 days.

superMiscConds.notes:
No contact with Miguel P. dob 2/8/67.
No contact with 1101 S. 1 Street, Milwaukee, WI. or 1927 Wynona Lane, Milwaukee, WI.
No possession of any firearms or weapons, firearm ammunition firearm holster, firearm magazine, or any body armor.
No possession of any drug paraphernalia for personal use, manufacturing, delivering or for distribution.
No possession of more than one cell phone or more than one phone number listed under the defendant's name at one time.
Not to possess cash currency in an amount greater than $150.00.
May not live or work where a firearm or controlled substances are kept.
No use or possession  of controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.
__________
Under section 973.049 Court finds and prohibits contact with Miguel P. dob 2/8/67 as he was a coactor in the case and it is in the interest of the public to prohibit contact.
Comply with all child support Court orders.

Participate in alcohol and drug assessment. Successfully complete recommended treatment including drug and alcohol testing.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  No alcohol.
**Conditions apply to both counts/case.

supervisions.notes:
Provide DNA sample if not already done.
Pursuant to Wisconsin Stattues section 973.176, the Court advised defendant of the following restrictions:  firearm possession  and voting.
____________________
Court advised defendant that under Wisconsin Statute 302.113 the amount actually served may be extended, and that the defendant could serve the entire bifurcated sentence in prison.  The defendant will be subject to certain conditions while on release to Extended supervision, and a violation of those conditions may result in the defendant being returned to prison.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with count one and  to case 14CF828, but consecutive to any other sentence.  Credit for 374 days.

Misc. documents from the Defense for the Court to review prior to Sentencing, received and filed.
In filed 14CF828.

Defendant Marcus L Pantoja in court with attorney Jane Heather Christopherson.  Defendant Marcus L Pantoja in custody.  Karl P. Hayes appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Additional statements by: Coralin A. 
AS TO COUNT 1:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 14 YEARS, concurrent to COUNT 2 and to case 14CF828, but consecutive to any other sentence; with credit for 374 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 8 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 6 YEARS.  
Defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Substance Abuse Program. 
Court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge to paid through collection by the department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b). Any remaining balance due by 3/15/2022; failure to pay will result in an entry of civil judgment. 
AS TO COUNT 2:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 8 YEARS, concurrent to COUNT 1 and to case 14CF828, but consecutive to any other sentence; with credit for 374 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 5 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 3 YEARS.  
Defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Substance Abuse Program. 
Court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge to paid through collection by the department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b). Any remaining balance due by 3/15/2022; failure to pay will result in an entry of civil judgment. 

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
- No contact with Miguel P. (DOB 2-8-67).
-No contact with 1101 S. 1st Street, Milwaukee WI or 1927 Wynona Lane, Milwaukee, WI. 
- No possession of any firearms or weapons, firearm ammunition, firearm holster, firearm magazine, or any body armor.
- No possession of any drug paraphernalia for personal use, manufacturing, delivering or for distribution.
- No possession of more than 1 cell phone or more than 1 phone number listed under the Defendants name at one time. 
- Defendant is not to possess cash currency in an amount greater than $150.00.
- Defendant may not live or work where a firearm or controlled substances are kept. 
- Maintain full time work. 
- Maintain Absolute Sobriety, no alcohol.
- No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid 
  prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.
- Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment
  and successfully complete recommended treatment
  including drug and alcohol testing. 
- Court ordered Defendant to comply with all child support court orders. 
- Provide DNA sample, if not already done. 

- Under section 973.049 Court finds and prohibits contact with Miguel P. (DOB 2-8-67) as he was a coactor in the case and it is in the interest of the public to prohibit contact.

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.
Court advises the Defendant that under Wisconsin Statute 302.113 the amount actually served may be extended, and that the Defendant could serve the entire bifurcated sentence in prison. The Defendant will be subject to certain conditions while on release to extended supervision, and a violation of any of those conditions may result in the Defendant being returned to prison. 
Appellate rights notice given to the defendant. 
Filed;
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit.

Attorney Jane Heather Christopherson in court, defendant Marcus L Pantoja not in court, in custody.  Karl P. Hayes appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case held off the record. Defendant produced, but not brought into the Court for the case being rescheduled off the record. Defense requests adjournment for Sentencing. State does not object to an adjournment. Case is adjourned for Sentencing on 3-4-2015 at 8:30 a.m., Br. 17.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for March 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Marcus L Pantoja in court with attorney Kristian Lindo for Jane Heather Christopherson.  Defendant Marcus L Pantoja in custody.  Karl P. Hayes appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
AS TO the Amended Count 1 and to Count 2 - 
The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Jury Instructions and Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.

Jury Trial scheduled for 1-28-2015 is vacated.
Case adjourned for Sentencing on 1-28-2015 at 8:30 a.m., Br. 17.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 28, 2015 at 08:30 am.

On motion of the State, Court ordered charge amended to Possession with Intent to Deliver Controlled Substance (Heroin) (>10-50 Grams), Second or Subsequent Offense, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section 961.41(1m)(d)3, 961.48(1)(a), a Class D Felony.

Attorney Jane Heather Christopherson in court, defendant Marcus L Pantoja not in court, in custody.  Karl P. Hayes appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case held off the record. Defense state there is possible resolution with the case and requests additional time to review with client. For the reasons presented to the Court the case is adjourned for Final Pretrial on 1-26-2015 at 1:30 p.m. Case remains calendared for Jury Trial on 1-28-2015 at 9:00 a.m.
Court also notes no objection to accepting case 14CF828 for global resolution.  Final pre-trial scheduled for January 26, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
